snippet: The nation’s largest organization of psychologists will investigate whether it supported the government’s use of torture in the interrogation of prisoners during the Bush administration.
abstract: American Psychological Association will conduct an independent review into whether it colluded with or supported government’s use of torture in interrogation of prisoners during Bush administration; questions about role of American psychologists and behavioral scientists in development and implementation of program have been raised by human rights advocates as well as critics within psychological profession itself.
lead_paragraph: The nation’s largest organization of psychologists will investigate whether it supported the government’s use of torture in the interrogation of prisoners during the Bush administration.

headline.main: Psychologists to Review Role in Detainee Interrogations
headline.print_headline: Psychologists to Review Role in Interrogations

keywords.value: Pay Any Price: Greed, Power, and Endless War (Book)
